description:
Join the team that unifies data and analytics talent across Chase to responsibly leverage data for our businesses with value and protection for customer, while providing an opportunity to materially impact both our customer and business outcomes.
As the Head of Acquisition and Deepening Analytics Data Science Director, you will be focused on directing analytical strategy to influence prospect acquisition and customer deepening marketing campaigns that will help with incremental, high-quality customer growth for the Consumer Bank. The team encompasses a variety of Data & Analytics disciplines, from data governance and data strategy/partnerships to reporting, data science and machine learning, and are actively engaged in ensuring impact at the front-line and the customer through Sales and Marketing transformation and you will sit in the engine that powers Chase with insights, providing an opportunity to materially impact both our customer and business outcomes.
Job Responsibilities:

Be a thought leader in partnership with marketing strategy managers, test design, audience management and modeling teams.
Interpret results to influence and be a trusted advisor to stakeholders and senior management including Consumer Bank Chief Marketing Officer, Chief Financial Officer, and Chief Executive Officer
Own the analytical strategy and book of work for the Acquisition and Deepening Analytics team which provides the end-to-end analytics for multiple campaign strategies (ex: regular campaign performance measurement, unstructured ad hoc analysis of customer behavior, A/B and incrementality test reads, profitability and optimization analysis)
Lead a team of 8 talented, entry level and experienced data scientists
Consult on experimental design, and continuously innovate through exploration of new techniques, platforms and data sources
Recruit and train talented data professionals from diverse backgrounds and maintain an inclusive team environment across Consumer Bank Marketing Analytics
Maintain a rigorous controls environment to ensure high quality data products and analytics

Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills:

Bachelor’s and Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline (Data Science/Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Economics, Finance or related fields)
8+ years of experience in applying statistical methods to real world marketing business problems including A/B testing, AI/ML, and customer journey analytics, financial analysis of marketing campaigns and investment optimization
Advanced SQL and at least one of the following analytical tools: SAS, Python, R
Experience with various tools & platforms including, visualization techniques for data analysis and presentation, web analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe/Omniture Insight/Visual Sciences, Webtrends, CoreMetrics, etc. and On-prem and Cloud data environments and automation tools, such as Control-M & Alteryx
3+ years of experience in a formal leadership position driving key analytics initiatives and deep subject matter expertise

Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills:

Financial services preferred
Tableau preferred
Teradata, AWS, & Snowflake preferred
Python preferred
